text: [Music]
[Music]
hello
i'm venai a cloud support engineer here
at the aws office in dallas
today i'll show you how to specify a
certificate in your cloudfund
distribution
and then set the communication to use
secure https let's get started
after logging into the aws management
console navigate to the clownfed console
then select the relevant existing
distribution
choose the edit button to alter the
distribution settings
specify the alternate domain name cnames
that your distribution uses
select the custom ssl certificate
the drop down list displays the valid
certificate that you can use
you can only use certificates present in
the north virginia region for cloudfund
if you don't have a valid certificate
you can request a no cost certificate
but choosing the request or import a
certificate with acm button
note that the certificate must include
the cnames that the cloudfund
distribution uses
if you are importing a certificate the
maximum supported certificate key size
is two zero forward bits
finally scroll to the bottom of the page
and choose the yes edit button
it takes several minutes to update the
global cloudfront distribution
allow some time to pass before checking
your distribution and seeing that the
new certificate is presented to the
browser
use browser to go to the sample site and
show the custom ssl certificate
as you can see the new certificate is
now being presented to the client
browser
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
